perturbation.original_text: This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of laws principles.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stipulates that New York law governs the agreement. By changing this to Delaware law and removing the phrase 'and construed in accordance with,' and adding 'without regard to its conflict of laws principles,' the contract now potentially avoids specific consumer protection laws that New York mandates for online retail transactions, especially concerning data privacy and security. Delaware is often perceived as more business-friendly and less consumer-protective.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Business Law, specifically statutes related to online consumer protection and data privacy.

perturbation.original_text: Sponsor will maintain accurate records with respect to the calculation of all payments due under this Agreement. Excite may, upon no less than thirty (30) days prior written notice to Sponsor, cause an independent Certified Public Accountant to inspect the records of Sponsor reasonably related to the calculation of such payments during Sponsor's normal business hours. The fees charged by such Certified Public Accountant in connection with the inspection will be paid by Excite unless the payments made to Excite are determined to have been less than ninety percent (90%) of the payment owed to Excite, in which case Sponsor will be responsible for the payment of the reasonable fees for such inspection.
perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor will maintain records with respect to the calculation of all payments due under this Agreement. Excite may request records. All fees associated are the responsibility of Excite.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting 'accurate' records, and the clause allowing Excite to hire an independent CPA to inspect records with costs borne by Sponsor if discrepancies are found, the contract weakens Excite's ability to verify payment accuracy. This introduces a legal risk as it could violate implied duties of good faith and fair dealing, which are generally recognized under contract law, especially in financial transactions. Removing the requirement of 'accurate' records keeping is an omission that goes against normal business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, generally applicable contract law principles.

perturbation.original_text: SPONSOR AND EXCITE WILL USE REASONABLE EFFORTS TO ENSURE THE ACCURACY OF THE USAGE REPORTS BUT NEITHER PARTY WARRANTS THAT THE USAGE REPORTS WILL CONFORM TO ANY SPECIFICATIONS AT ANY GIVEN TIME. NEITHER PARTY WILL BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIMS AS THEY RELATE TO SUCH USAGE REPORTS, EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT THAT SUCH USAGE REPORTS SERVE AS THE BASIS FOR PAYMENTS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: SPONSOR AND EXCITE will provide usage reports. NEITHER PARTY WILL BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIMS AS THEY RELATE TO SUCH USAGE REPORTS.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'WILL USE REASONABLE EFFORTS TO ENSURE THE ACCURACY OF THE USAGE REPORTS BUT NEITHER PARTY WARRANTS THAT THE USAGE REPORTS WILL CONFORM TO ANY SPECIFICATIONS AT ANY GIVEN TIME EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT THAT SUCH USAGE REPORTS SERVE AS THE BASIS FOR PAYMENTS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT.' creates a loophole in the Sponsor's commitment to provide accurate reports and removes a clause in which it will be liable for the report's influence on payments, potentially allowing Excite to manipulate usage report data. Usage reports must be truthful or a breach of contract would occur.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of contract law regarding misrepresentation and fraudulent inducement.
